author: Travis B
comment: Weather doesn't work needs fixed
Does not appear in Android wear or on watch, I purchased it and want my money back

author: Yang Liu
comment: Weather is displayed in absolute Kelvin degrees. So you need to minus 273 for Celsius. Otherwise good watchface. I have gear neo 2.

author: Dallas Coats
comment: Great design. The weather isn't correct, at all..... EVER. I have it set for the appropriate degrees and it's off. I have GPS on and it's still not right. Uninstalled. Please fix

author: Roger Smith
comment: Like the Look, BUT.. Weather and Wind Needs Fixing still, I can't used it if just shows useless data. Colour customisation and changeable heart rate area would also improve

author: Philmore Harrison
comment: Worst watch face ever, doesn't work on huawei watch 2, only some green dots on screen and that's it

author: Marc Ducote
comment: It's ok.  So much info it's hard to read. If there's a way to change display color, I haven't found it yet.   The Zulu time could be replaced with something else or deleted to make font bigger. But it does seem to work.

author: Sunil Mahajan
comment: It is a very useful watch face. It works very well.
title: Great watch face

author: Dylan Yarbrough
comment: For the most part, this watch face is awesome. Maybe allow the face to draw weather info from a different weather service other than the default option. Always on display seems to not work for my Zen watch 2. I've already checked the app and watch settings, both are set to display ambient mode, but it's still not working. Then lastly, include a color pallet so we can change that green color to whatever we want. This app would be great with some of those tweaks implemented.
title: Could use some tweaks

author: Corey Dunn
comment: In color mode it looks so nice. I only wish I could have Color display in ambient mode with no animations (to help battery).   Then it would be perfect.
title: Such an awesome watchface

author: Christian Critterton
comment: It's just too small to read. I love the info.  Maybe sacrifice an item or two to increase the font size. Unfortunately,  I'll be requesting my money back.
title: Great watch face but

author: Jesus R. Casales
comment: So far so good, I like the watch. I will give 5 start is battery life is good, time will tell.
title: Awesome

author: Phil Barnes
comment: My heart numbers r not showing up tryed everything

author: Sanjay Mohan Dubey
comment: like multiple info and quite accurate!
title: great watchface

author: Bestestimes Videos/Tech & More
comment: Cant change temp to C. LG G Watch.  Refund
title: Can't customise

author: nary HZD
comment: Got some issues. Weather have some bug i think it shows -------- instead of weather status. Couldnt find an option to change watch color. Cant find step count. And one more think it is better to user to replace zulu time with another time. And for watches like sony smartwatch 3 that hasnt heart rate, to replace it with some thing else like compass maybe. But its awesome watchface i love it.
title: Niceeeeee

author: Garner Marshall
comment: I love the update. Battery life seems to have improved. The information that the phone displays on the watch face is very helpful.
title: Excellent watch face

author: VoIP SOUK :
comment: Easy-to-use
title: Good

author: Patrick Keough
comment: Weather is hit or miss. It seems like most of the time I am looking at little lines on my urbane instead of the weather. I tried both automatic and fixed location. Also, with all the customization options, you cannot set the timezone of the second time (zulu)? Come on now. Otherwise, this is my favorite digital watch face. I just don't know if it is worth paying for at this point.
title: Needs a little work

author: Geoff Davison
comment: Too small to read and eats battery.  Want money back but left it too long while testing its performance.  Unless you have very good eyesight and don't mind a frequently flat battery don't bother.

reply.author: Smartwatch Bureaux
reply.content:
Thank you for your feedback.
Would you please give us your situation more in detail,we'd like to improve.
Please feel free to contact our email address.
Thank you.

title: Illegible battery hog

author: charles martin
comment: Love it
title: Perfect

author: Lukasz Lech
comment: Love it

author: brent singer
comment: Well done! I love this face however I truly wish your round face for the 3x time zones could be modified for  the gear live. Just a friendly request but amazing work on all your projects!
title: Beautiful

author: Mason Malave
comment: Its a great watch face tells you a lot but watch but when I have it set to black and white mode only it doesn't show the seconds on the digital or analog time which sucks.  also since my lg g watch doesn't have a heart rate monitor you can disable it but the image Is still there it would be cool if you can enlarge the two other circles (power for devices) or have an option to add something different such as how many steps you've taken instead   also a compass somewhere would be awesome fix that then 5 stars
title: Great but some  issues

author: Nathan Levine
comment: Superb is a weird word. This watch face is good.
title: Superb

author: Haryo Wiranto
comment: excellent!

author: Matei Mihai
comment: Nice work !
title: F05 WatchFace

author: nicolas montvignier
comment: Beautifull design, full of nice features
title: Love it

author: William O'Connor
comment: Very encompassing watchface with access to nearly all the data one could want in a watch.
title: F05 Watchface

author: Richard Gaywood
comment: An information-packed display that still looks good, but its a battery hog even with cautious data poll times. Two small feature requests, though: (1) provide a way to disable the heart rate display on devices that don't have a monitor (2) have an option to set the second timezone to anything rather than locking it to UTC. I live in UTC and I don't need two clocks showing the same time :) But I regularly work with people in Mountain View and would like to see their local time at a glance.
title: Pretty good

author: john mercado
comment: Only down side is it plays on your battery . haven't played with the intervals on weather, bpm and things of that nature that may help. Nevertheless one of the best clean informative watch faces around. Moto 360
title: Great!!!!!

author: Bogdan Oprea
comment: What it's missing: - compas - the ability to replace zulu time with another time zone - the ability to customize the interface a bit (for example replace the wind speed or zulu time with a compas) - smart bpm, if it's chargin stop monitoring all the data - google fit connection (send the heart rate data to google fit so it can add it to it's statistics) - Quick ways to turn on or off speed and heartrate traking (swipe left or right  to start stop) - an economic mode, if the phone's battery is under 15% stop monitoring and minimize syncing.
title: Almost the swiss knife of watchfaces

author: David Taylor
comment: One of the best in this series
title: Like it!

author: Vincent Delarmente
comment: Nice!

author: Web DesignInc
comment: Absolutely would rate this 5.stars but the weather and wind speed sections do not work.  (used the fixes location setting...set to NYC and Chicago, IL..Both failed to produce weather and windspeed).  I have the LG Urbane (with HTC one m8) and tried this version as well as the motor 360 version. Both versions have the same problem.  If this can be fixed, I would gladly buy and rate 5 Stars, but for now uninstalled for refund. Please FIX
title: Beautiful, but WEATHER doesn't work

comment: Try again later? WTF? I don't line it and I want my money back

title: Can't give you a refund now

author: Wilson Bradley
comment: Nice,  but to busy/small to see.  Would be nice if you could pick items on screen and maybe position using phone app
